snippet: Economic recovery in the United States may be slow, but it is steady, while several European economies are either shrinking or stalling.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off The Charts column points out the United States economic recovery may be slow, but it seems to be steady, while several European economies are either shrinking or stalling; compares the change in GDP in several nations from 2009 to 2012.
lead_paragraph: Economic recovery in the United States may be slow, but it is steady, while several European economies are either shrinking or stalling.

headline.print_headline: Recovery in U.S., Though Lackluster, Trumps Europe’s
headline.seo: U.S. Recovery, Though Lackluster, Trumps European Stagnation
headline.main: Recovery in U.S., Though Lackluster, Trumps Europe’s
